children.name: give sb a hand
children.definition: give/lend a handinformalto help someone do something, especially something they have to doin their homesuch ascarryingorliftingthings: giúp một tay
examples: Scott is moving Saturday and I promised to lend a hand.

children.name: give/lend somebody a hand
examples: Give me a hand and let’s see if we can get this box in the car.

children.name: give/lend a hand with
examples: Could you give me a hand with the shopping.

children.name: help
children.definition: to make it easier for sb to do sth by doing part of their work, showing them what to do, or giving them sth they need:
examples: ▪ Dad, I don’t understand my homework. Will you help me?

children.name: help with
examples: ▪ Dan’s mother has been great about helping with the kids.

children.name: help do something
examples: ▪ Warren offered to help clean up the house after the party.

children.name: help to do something
examples: ▪ Part of the assistant’s job is to help to organize conferences and keep the director informed.

children.name: help somebody do something
examples: ▪ Help me lift this, will you?

children.name: help somebody to do something
examples: ▪ Her uncle said he would help her to find a job.

children.name: help somebody with something
examples: ▪ Do you want me to help you with those bags?

children.name: help somebody into/off/across/down etchelp someone go somewhere
examples: ▪ ‘Did you enjoy the trip?’ asked Jack, helping her out of the boat.

children.name: assist
children.definition: to help sb do sth, especially by doing all the easier or less important things for them so that their job is easier: trợ giúp
examples: Can you do the job alone, or do you want someone to assist you?

children.name: assist in
examples: In this position, you will assist in training new employees.

children.name: assist with
examples: Some of the guests assisted with the preparation of the food.

children.name: assist sb with/in sth
examples: You will be employed to assist in the development of new equipment.
A consultant has been brought in to assist management in restructuring the company.

children.name: ►Do not say ‘assist someone to do something’. Sayassist someone with somethingorassist someone in doing something:The teacher assists the children with their tasks.|someone who can assist them in planning their careers
do sb a favour
children.definition: UK /favorUS  to do sth to help sb, especially a friend or sbyou know well:
examples: Could you do me a favour and mail these letters for me?
She’s always doing favours for us. The least we can do is help her out now.

children.name: do sb a big favour/favorhelp someone a lot
examples: They did us a big favor by letting us stay there, you know.

children.name: do sth for U
children.definition: do sth for  to help sb by doing sth for them that they wouldnormallydothemselves:
examples: If you’re not feeling well, I’ll do the shopping for you.
Did you have someone do your homework for you? It doesn’t look like your writing.

children.name: help out
children.definition: to help sb do sth, especially because there are not enough people to do all the work: phụ giúp
examples: ▪ Their son used to help out in the shop when it was busy.
▪ Organizing the school trip will be a lot of work, so I need some volunteers to help out.

children.name: help out with
examples: ▪ The kids are always good about helping out with the chores.

children.name: help out
examples: ▪ While I’m gone, try to help your Mom out, OK?
▪ No need to thank me - I was just glad to help out a friend.

children.name: do sb a good turn
children.definition: old fashion to help sb by doing sth for them that they have not asked you to do, because you think they need your help and you want to help them: giúp không cần nhờ tới
examples: ▪ She’s always happy to do a stranger a good turn.
▪ He did me a good turn when he advised me not to sell my house - it’s worth twice as much now.

children.name: do your bit U
children.definition: do your bitUK /do your partUS  to do what you can to help in a bad or difficult situation, especially because you think you are expected to do it or that it is your duty:

children.name: ▪ I’ve done my bit - now it’s up to you.do your bit for
examples: ▪ Brown feels that she’s done her part for the Democratic Party.

children.name: come to sb’s aid
children.definition: come to somebody’s aid/assistance  formal to offer to help someone who is in difficulty and who will not be able to continue without your help:

children.name: Đến trợ giúp / trợ giúp của ai đó
examples: ▪ It took an ambulance 27 minutes to come to the aid of the accident victims.
Phải mất một chiếc xe cứu thương 27 phút để đến giúp đỡ nạn nhân tai nạn.
▪ Many expect the central government to come to the assistance of the ailing industry.
Nhiều người mong đợi chính phủ trung ương đến trợ giúp của ngành công nghiệp ốm yếu.

children.name: give help
children.definition: /assistance/support  to help a person or group:

children.name: give help/assistance/support to
examples: ▪ The program gives assistance to unemployed mothers and their children.

children.name: give sb help/assistance/support
examples: ▪ My family gave me very little support when I decided to go back to college.
▪ Any kind of help you can give would be greatly appreciated.

children.name: helper
children.definition: someone who helps someone else to do something, especially when they want to do it and are not paid for it: Người giúp đỡ
examples: ▪ Ella works at the hospital once a week as a voluntary helper.

children.name: assistant
children.definition: sb who is employed to help someone do their job, especially by doing all the easier or less important things for them so that their job is made easier: phụ tá, trợ lí

children.name: ▪ The dentist had her assistant sterilise the instruments.assistant to
examples: ▪ Lydia is the assistant to the Director of Finance.

children.name: assistant manager/director/editor etc
examples: ▪ Winston got a job as assistant manager at Wal-Mart.

children.name: aide
children.definition: sb who is employed to help a very important person, especially sb in politics or government: trợ lý
examples: ▪ An aide confirmed this week that the President will not be running for re-election.
aidealsoaid[C] USteacher’s aid/nurse’s aidsomeone whose job is to help a teacher, nurse etc to do their work, especially by doing the less important jobs:trợ giảng, phụ tá
▪ Amelia went to work as a nurse’s aide in the children’s wing of the hospital.
▪ As a teacher’s aide, I help watch the children and run errands for the teacher.

children.name: aide to
examples: ▪ Anderson has worked as an aide to the mayor for three years.

children.name: right-hand man
children.definition: the person who someone in a position of authority depends on most to help and support them:
examples: ▪ Beria, the head of the KGB, was Stalin’s right-hand man.
▪ Newman’s resignation leaves his boss without a right-hand man.

children.name: help
children.definition: things you do to make it easier or possible for sb to do sth: sự giúp đỡ
examples: Thank you for all your help.
help[U] advice, treatment, information, or money which is given to people who need it : giúp đỡ
A lot of these children need professional help.
help with
You may be able to ask for help with the rent.
We received no help from the police.

children.name: give somebody help
examples: Do you want me to give you some help?

children.name: ask
children.definition: somebody
examples: for helpHe asked for help with the cleaning.

children.name: need help
examples: Some of the older patients need help with walking.

children.name: get/receive help
examples: She gets no help from her husband.

children.name: offer
children.definition: your
examples: helpThe taxi driver offered his help and we accepted.

children.name: provide help
examples: The goverment should do more to provide help for people who are looking for work.

children.name: appeal for help
children.definition: publicly ask for help
examples: The police are appealing for help to track down the killer.

children.name: enlist sb’s help
children.definition: persuade someone to help you
examples: She enlisted the help of a private investigator to find her missing son.

children.name: find help
examples: To get it finished by tomorrow, we’ll need to find help from somewhere.

children.name: financial help
examples: We received a lot of financial help from my family.

children.name: professional help
examples: You need to seek some professional help.

children.name: medical help
examples: She needs urgent medical help.

children.name: legal help
examples: You can find free legal help for your problem by logging onto our website.

children.name: technical help
examples: I might need some technical help understanding the instructions.

children.name: practical help
examples: The organization offers practical help with finding accommodation.

children.name: expert help
examples: If the issues are complex, expert help can be sought from the adoption agency.

children.name: get/receive help from somebody
examples: You will be able to get confidential help from your doctor.

children.name: give
children.definition: somebody
examples: helpThe fund was set up to give financial help to war veterans.

children.name: provide help
examples: If you have to move, we provide financial help towards the cost.

children.name: offer help
examples: We offer free help for people with debts.

children.name: seek help
children.definition: ask for help
examples: He decided to seek medical help for his drink problem.

children.name: help with something/with doing something
examples: Do you want any help with the washing up?

children.name: help to do something
examples: I could do with some help to bring the bags in from the car.

children.name: help (in) doing something
examples: He asked for my help in getting an interview with her.

children.name: with the help of somebody/with sb’s help
examples: We manage, with the help of a nurse who comes daily.

children.name: a hand
children.definition: practical help from someone when something needs to be done:
examples: ▪ Everybody needs a hand now and then.

children.name: a hand with
examples: ▪ I could use a hand with the yard work if you’re not busy.

children.name: lend/give sb a hand
examples: ▪ Could you give me a hand moving those boxes?

children.name: assistance
children.definition: sth you provide in order to help someone do something: Assistanceis more formal thanhelp, and is used especially about people giving official help:
examples: We offer financial assistance to students.
Can Ibe ofanyassistance(= can I help you )?

children.name: need assistance
examples: Phone this number if you need any assistance.

children.name: get/receive assistance
examples: She got no assistance from her family.

children.name: seek assistance
examples: If side-effects are severe, seek medical assistance.

children.name: give
children.definition: somebody
examples: assistanceOur staff can give assistance with any problems that may arise.

children.name: offer assistance
examples: I would be grateful for any assistance you can offer.

children.name: provide assistance
examples: There is no doubt that the US will provide assistance.

children.name: pledge/promise assistance
examples: A group of donors led by the World Bank promised assistance to the value of US$508,000,000.

children.name: ask for/request assistance
examples: Police are at the scene and have requested assistance.

children.name: financial assistance
examples: The company may also provide financial assistance.

children.name: technical assistance
examples: Most of our time is spent providing technical assistance to companies.

children.name: legal/medical assistance
examples: It was difficult to get good legal assistance.

children.name: military assistance
examples: Beijing renewed its military assistance to North Korea.

children.name: be of assistance
children.definition: help
examples: ‘How can I be of assistance to you?’ she asked.

children.name: come to sb’s assistance
children.definition: help someone
examples: One of her fellow passengers came to her assistance.

children.name: turn to somebody for assistance
children.definition: ask them to help
examples: The elderly sometimes have no one to turn to for assistance.

children.name: with the assistance of sb/sth
examples: We’ve rebuilt the theatre with the assistance of the National Lottery.

children.name: economic assistancehumanitarian aid and other forms of economic assistance
aid
children.definition: help.Aidis more formal thanhelp, and is used especially about money, food, medicine etc. that is given to countries or people that are in a very bad situation: viện trợ
examples: He has been grantedlegal aid

children.name: foreign/international/overseas aid
examples: The development of the continent is now dependent on foreign aid.

children.name: legal aid
examples: If you are on a low income, you may qualify for legal aid.

children.name: financial/economic aid
examples: The commission said it was ready to provide financial aid to help farmers.

children.name: military aid
examples: Israel is the largest recipient of U.S. economic and military aid.

children.name: medical aid
examples: The capital was in urgent need of food and medical aid.

children.name: food aid
examples: The government launched an appeal for emergency food aid for 60,000 people.

children.name: humanitarian aid
children.definition: given to people living in very bad conditions
examples: Ministers agreed to send humanitarian aid, including food and medical supplies.

children.name: relief/emergency aid
children.definition: given when there is a disaster, a war etc
examples: Surrounding countries supplied disaster relief aid.

children.name: development aid
children.definition: given to help develop poor countries
examples: It’s one of the poorest countries in the world, but it has received no UN development aid.

children.name: send/provide aid
examples: EU Ministers meeting in Belgium agreed to send humanitarian aid.

children.name: ask for/appeal for aid
examples: The Chinese authorities have asked for aid to help the earthquake victims.

children.name: get/receive aid
examples: Ethiopia receives less foreign aid than any other developing country.

children.name: depend on/rely on aid
examples: The report stated that some 703,000 people relied on food aid.

children.name: suspend aid
children.definition: officially stop aid from continuing, usually for a short time
examples: Canada will be suspending aid until democracy is restored.

children.name: cut off/withdraw aid
children.definition: stop giving aid
examples: The US has threatened to cut off aid to the region.|Conditons deteriorated further as western aid was withdrawn.

children.name: qualify for aid
children.definition: alsobe eligible for aid
examples: (= have the right to be given aid )The project is eligible for aid from the British Tourist Board.

children.name: an appeal/request for aid
examples: International aid agencies launched an appeal for emergency aid.

children.name: an aid worker
examples: Aid workers warned of a worsening situation.

children.name: aid agency
examples: The sanctions could prevent international aid agencies from delivering food and medicine.

children.name: an aid programme/scheme/package
examples: The UN aid programme provided most of the finance.

children.name: backup
children.definition: back-up/ extra people, equipment etc that can be used in case people need help: help:hỗ trợ (khi cần thiết)
examples: This department needs more secretarial and clerical back-up.
Police had to wait for backup to arrive before making any arrests.
The officer waited for backup to arrive before making any arrests.

children.name: relief
children.definition: money, food, clothes etc given to people who are poor or hungry: cứu tế; cứu viện
examples: money raised for therelief effort
disaster/famine/flood etc relief
famine relief for victims of the drought

children.name: disaster/emergency relief
examples: Our objective is to provide food aid and emergency relief to developing countries.

children.name: famine/flood relief
examples: We donated $1,000 to the American Red Cross for flood relief.

children.name: a relief agency/organization
examples: Relief agencies reported that many of the refugees had arrived in a terrible condition.

children.name: relief supplies/aid
examples: US troops had helped distribute relief supplies to Kurdish refugees in northern Iraq.

children.name: relief efforts
examples: In areas severely affected by the earthquake, it is difficult to coordinate relief efforts.

children.name: a relief operation
examples: UN officials accused the government of obstructing relief operations in the south of the country.

children.name: a relief worker
examples: The relief workers have to bring in clean drinking water by tanker.

children.name: relief work
examples: The charity raised over five million pounds for relief work.

children.name: a relief convoy/flight
examples: A relief convoy of 10 trucks set off with food and medical supplies.

children.name: contact
children.definition: nounPERSON

children.name: bridge
children.definition: nounLARGE STRUCTURE

children.name: contribution
children.definition: something that you give or do in order to help something be successful

children.name: make a contribution
examples: I’d like everyone to make a contribution towards the discussion.

children.name: acknowledge/recognize sb’s contribution
children.definition: say that you are grateful for what someone has done
examples: He acknowledged the contribution of many individuals in developing the report.

children.name: value sb’s contribution
children.definition: think that someone’s contribution is important
examples: They didn’t seem to value my contribution.

children.name: a major/great contribution
examples: Tourism makes a major contribution to the local economy.

children.name: a positive contribution
examples: We want kids to grow up to make a positive contribution to society.

children.name: a huge contribution
examples: This player has made a huge contribution to our club.

children.name: a significant/important contribution
examples: All of you can make a significant contribution to the organization.

children.name: a useful/valuable contribution
examples: I joined the society because I felt I could make a useful contribution.

children.name: an invaluable/outstanding contribution
children.definition: extremely useful
examples: He won the award for his outstanding contribution over many years.

children.name: a vital contribution
children.definition: a very important one
examples: Volunteers make a vital contribution in this country.

children.name: contribution to/towards
examples: Einstein was awarded the Nobel Prize for his contribution to Quantum Theory.
The school sees its job as preparing students tomakeacontributionto society.

children.name: significant/substantial/valuable etc contribution
examples: Wolko made outstanding contributions to children’s medicine.

children.name: interest
children.definition: nounADVANTAGEquyền lợi; lợi ích
examples: [ C usually plural U ] something that brings advantages to or affects someone orsomething
_A union looks after the interests of its members.
_It'sin hisinterests to keep careful records.
_In theinterestsofsafety, please do not smoke.
Vì lợi ích an toàn , xin đừng hút thuốc
_Despite what you think, I'm only acting in yourbestinterests

children.name: oblige
children.definition: verbHELPlàm ơn, gia ơn, giúp đỡ

children.name: for the sake of
children.definition: sb/forsb'ssake. Vì lợi ích của

children.name: in order to help or bring advantage to someone
examples: _Please do it, for David's sake.
_Their parents only stayed together for the sake of the children.
_I hope for both our sakes that you're right!

children.name: pull strings
children.definition: to secretly use the influence you have over important people in order to get something or to help someone
examples: _I may be able to pull a few strings if you need the document urgently.

children.name: your last resort
children.definition: be

children.name: to be the only person or thing that might be able to help you, when every other person or possibility has failed
examples: _You have to help me - you're my last resort.
